basics.name: Georg Hermann Praßl
basics.headline: Technical Delivery Lead | Full-Stack Architecture | Agile Transformation
basics.location: now: Graz, Austria; future: Krems/Donau, Austria

profile: Senior IT leader and full-stack engineer with 10+ years across Enterprise IT and automotive manufacturing. Combine hands‑on engineering (Angular, TypeScript, Node.js/.NET, SQL, Keycloak) with Agile delivery (Scrum, SAFe), stakeholder management, and conflict resolution to align technology with business outcomes. As BRM/IT consultant and project lead, led a local datacenter transformation—optimizing scope and vendor model to cut a planned 5‑year budget from €1.5M to €170k while maintaining SLAs and operational stability. Track record of modernizing platforms, introducing CI/CD, and motivating high‑performing teams; recognized for lateral leadership and clear communication from shop floor to C‑level.

skills.name: Technical Leadership & Team Enablement
skills.subline: Teamlead for 20 people, onboarding standards, coaching, stakeholder alignment

skills.name: Agile Delivery & Project Management
skills.subline: SAFe, Scrum, IPMA, end-to-end responsibility, planning, execution

skills.name: Solution Architecture & Full-Stack Engineering
skills.subline: Angular/TypeScript frontend + Node/Express + MSSQL + IAM + legacy modernization

skills.name: IT Operations & Infrastructure Ownership
skills.subline: Datacenter transformation, service provider management, network planning, ITIL mindset

skills.name: Business & Stakeholder Management
skills.subline: Budget ownership €1.5M → €170k optimization, Business Relationship Manager, vendor negotiation

subHighlights: Lateral Leadership: Bridged Engineering and IT departments, aligning conflicting stakeholder interests with strategic business goals.
Conflict Resolution: Navigated departmental silos and high-pressure negotiations to streamline digitalization roadmaps.
Team Building: Mentored cross-functional project teams and motivated external providers to exceed SLA requirements.
Strategic Optimization: Re-engineered a 5-year project scope, slashing the planned budget from €1.5M to €170k (88% saving) while maintaining full operational stability.
Stakeholder Management: Influenced executive buy-in for lean infrastructure by prioritizing critical requirements over legacy 'nice-to-haves.'
Operations Oversight: Primary lead for datacenter operations and third-party service provider management.
Tech Stack: Angular, TypeScript, Node.js, SQL, Keycloak.
Agile Delivery: Spearheaded CI/CD implementation and Agile best practices to enhance development efficiency and product quality.
Legacy Modernization: Led the overhaul of outdated internal tools, improving user experience and system performance.

employment.title: Full Stack Developer
highlights: Change Management: Led the high-impact re-branding initiative and successfully migrated legacy JSP web architecture to Angular, improving performance and scalability.
IAM Modernization: Spearheaded the implementation of Ory Kratos as the new enterprise Identity and Access Management (IAM) framework.
Backend & DevOps: Optimized legacy Java backends and introduced GitLab CI/CD pipelines to automate deployments and increase release velocity.
Infrastructure Leadership: Orchestrated office relocation technical strategy; designed network infrastructure and negotiated high-value ISP contracts and tariffs.
Operational Standardization: Transformed workplace operations by creating a centralized hardware/software inventory and standardizing the employee onboarding process.

employment.title: Full Stack Developer
highlights: Full stack developer
Back-end: .NET Framework
Front-end: React, React Native, Angular, Dojo Toolkit
Worked with Scrum methods
Regularly attending at sprint planning, daily stand-ups, story estimating
Worked on different projects, from small two to three months projects to large three years projects for customers in Austria and Germany

employment.title: Teamleader
highlights: Led 20 employees on the night shift; ensured output quality and safety compliance.
Produced daily shift reports and optimized resource allocation.
Resolved conflicts and strengthened team cohesion; partnered with project managers on cost and resource strategies.

employment.title: Soldier KIOP/KPE
highlights: KIOP/KPE soldier with a 6-month KFOR deployment in Kosovo.
Worked in multinational teams under high-pressure conditions, adhering to strict safety and communication protocols.
